title: UPDATE: Deceased teen shooting victim in Rockford identified
content:
ROCKFORD (WREX) -
Rockford Police have identified the teen who died at a local hospital after a shooting early Monday morning. The teen is identified as Izaiah Sanders, 16, from Rockford, a Guilford student.
According to the Winnebago County Coroner's office, the 16-year-old died around 3:49 a.m. due to injuries caused by a gun shot. Police say Sanders was shot in the torso.
Early this morning Rockford Police were called to the 4800 block of Creek View Road. They found Sanders suffering from a gunshot wound. He was transported to an area hospital where he later died.
Police say the initial investigation showed there was a gathering at the complex, and a disagreement escalated into a shot fired. Police say detectives are conducting interviews with witnesses and are investigating the shooting as a homicide.
No arrests have been made in the shooting. If you have information please call Rockford Police or Crime Stoppers.
A teen boy is rushed to the hospital after being shot early Monday morning.
Around 1 a.m. Monday morning, Rockford Police were called to the 4800 Block of Creek View Road. When they arrived, they found a teen boy suffering a single gunshot wound. He was transported to an area hospital. No word yet on his condition.
No arrests have been made. If you have any information, please call Rockford Police or Crime Stoppers.
